intro: Funastrum rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved funastrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, rounded leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique leaf morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
